intro: Oreodaphne suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-smelling daphne, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Anacardiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in yellow or white. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Its fruits are small, red drupes that contain a single seed. Oreodaphne suaveolens is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some cultures.
